function brute_force_algo(adj: AdjacencyList):
    (global) cycles <- (empty set)
    testCombinations(adj, [ ], adj.nodes())
    return cycles

function check_cycle(adj: AdjacencyList, path: list(Node)):
    if path.length == 0:
        return false
    else if path.length == 1:
        return path[0].linksto(path[0])
    else:
        for n in (0 to path.length - 2):
            if not path[n].linksto(path[n+1]):
                return false

    if path[path.length-1].linksto(path[0]):
        return true
    else:
        return false

function test(adj: AdjacencyList, path: list(Node)):
    if check_cycle(adj, path):
        cycles.add(unique(path)) # unique will be a function that ensures all cycles are unique

function combinations_helper(adj: AdjacencyList, curPath: list(Node), remainingVertices: set(Node)):
    test(adj, curPath)

    for n in remainingVertices:
        newRemaining = remainingVertices.copy()
        newRemaining.remove(n)
        newPath = curPath.copy()
        newPath.append(n)
        combinations_helper(adj, newPath, newRemaining)
